alert.note: Alert for Knox (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:57PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Knox County through 630 PM CDT... At 556 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles southeast of Guthrie, moving southeast at 35 mph. Although the strongest part of this storm will likely remain west and south of Knox County, strong winds from this storm will still be possible across southwestern Knox County. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Knox City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
